questions.question_text: In which section of the PAN-OS GUI does an administrator configure URL Filtering profiles?

discussion.content:
Viewing questions 351-390 out of 397 questions...
where we can see 9 more questions? :-)

Selected Answer: C
Like a2mhkzz said:
Step 1: Create a URL Filtering profile.
Select Objects > Security Profiles > URL Filtering and Add or modify a URL Filtering profile.

should be C
Step 1: Create a URL Filtering profile.
Select Objects > Security Profiles > URL Filtering and Add or modify a URL Filtering profile.

questions.question_text: Which profile should be used to obtain a verdict regarding analyzed files?

discussion.content:
C is correct

WildFire Analysis Profiles
Use a WildFire Analysis profile to enable the firewall to forward unknown files or email links for WildFire analysis. Specify files to be forwarded for analysis based on application, file type, and transmission direction (upload or download). Files or email links matched to the profile rule are forwarded to either the WildFire public cloud or the WildFire private cloud (hosted with a WF-500 appliance), depending on the analysis location defined for the rule. If a profile rule is set to forward files to the WildFire public cloud, the firewall also forwards files that match existing antivirus signatures, in addition to unknown files.

questions.question_text: In which three places on the PAN-OS interface can the application characteristics be found? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ACD
ACD
I have checked it on my palo firewall.
The answer is ACD; Application Group there are no Application Characteristics. There is in ACC -> Global Filters -> Application. I am in the WEB UI of a PA-820 right now.

Selected Answer: ABC
ABC Make more sense form me. I can find all the app char into Applications, Application Filters and (Application Groups -->Browse), However I can not see single app into ACC tab because I am using test virtual firewall with no traffic to log xD

Selected Answer: ACD
i believe these are the right ones.

Why not ABD? 
A. Objects tab > Applications <-- Shows the chars
B. Objects tab > Application Groups <-- Shows the chars
C. Objects tab > Application Filters <-- Doesn't show the chars
D. ACC tab > Global Filters <-- You can set the global filter by selecting App--App Char
E. Isn't applicable

Selected Answer: ACD
ACD is the correct, there is no Characteristics in App Groups page

ACD - A. Objects tab > Applications1 C. Objects tab > Application Filters1 D. ACC tab > Global Filters1

Objects tab > Applications: This is where you can define new applications and view or modify the characteristics of existing applications1.
Objects tab > Application Filters: Application filters dynamically group applications based on application attributes that you define, including category, subcategory, technology, risk factor, and characteristic1.
ACC tab > Global Filters: The Application Command Center (ACC) uses application characteristics as a global filter to provide visibility and control of the applications in use across all users and devices in all locations1
ACD are correct... checked in fw

Selected Answer: ABC
Ill go with ABC

The application characteristics can be found in three places on the PAN-OS interface: Objects tab > Application Filters, Objects tab >
Application Groups, and Objects tab > Applications. These places allow you to view and manage the applications and application groups

D is correct.

Add the user account to the local database.
Select DeviceLocal User DatabaseUsers and click Add.
Enter a user Name for the administrator.
Enter a Password and Confirm Password or enter a Password Hash.
Enable the account (enabled by default) and click OK.

choices.B: Device > Local User Database > End Users

questions.question_text: Where within the firewall GUI can an administrator create a local user database?

choices.A: By the OSPF protocol, as part of Dijkstra's algorithm, to give access to the various services offered in the network
choices.C: For routing, because they are the shortest path selected by the BGP routing protocol
choices.B: To statically route subnets so they are joinable from, and have access to, the Palo Alto Networks external services
choices.D: To route management plane services through data interfaces rather than the management interface

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
This isn't very clear. I will still go with D it is the closest one.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct
